trans-unit.source: The exception that is thrown when an error occurs while accessing the network through a pluggable protocol.

The <xref:System.Net.WebException> class is thrown by classes descended from <xref:System.Net.WebRequest> and <xref:System.Net.WebResponse> that implement pluggable protocols for accessing the Internet.

When <xref:System.Net.WebException> is thrown by a descendant of the <xref:System.Net.WebRequest> class, the <xref:System.Net.WebException.Response%2A> property provides the Internet response to the application.
**Associated Tips**
**Check the Response property of the exception to determine why the request failed.**

When a <xref:System.Net.WebException> exception is thrown by a descendent of the <xref:System.Net.WebRequest> class, the <xref:System.Net.WebException.Response%2A> property provides the Internet response to the application.
**Check the Status property of the exception to determine why the request failed.**
The <xref:System.Net.WebException.Status%2A> property of the exception provides status information for the error.
For more information, see <xref:System.Net.WebExceptionStatus>.
**If you are timing out when stepping into an XML Web Service, set the timeout value for the XML Web Service call to infinite.**
For more information, see [Error: Timeout While Debugging Web Services](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/4b7df112-788a-4429-9a0c-4c6dac4fb609).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Net.WebException"></xref> class.
The default constructor initializes a new instance of the <xref:System.Net.WebException> class.
The <xref:System.Exception.Message%2A> property is initialized to a system-supplied message that describes the error.
This message takes into account the current system culture.
The <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> and <xref:System.Net.WebException.Response%2A> properties are initialized to `null`.
The <xref:System.Net.WebException.Status%2A> property is initialized to <xref:System.Net.WebExceptionStatus.RequestCanceled>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Net.WebException"></xref> class with the specified error message.
The <xref:System.Net.WebException> instance is initialized with the <xref:System.Exception.Message%2A> property set to the value of `message`.
If `message` is `null`, the <xref:System.Exception.Message%2A> property is initialized to a system-supplied message.
The <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> and <xref:System.Net.WebException.Response%2A> properties are initialized to `null`.
The <xref:System.Net.WebException.Status%2A> property is initialized to <xref:System.Net.WebExceptionStatus.RequestCanceled>.
The text of the error message.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Net.WebException"></xref> class from the specified <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> and <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext"></xref> instances.
This constructor implements the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable> interface for the <xref:System.Net.WebException> class.
A <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> that contains the information required to serialize the new <xref href="System.Net.WebException"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext"></xref> that contains the source of the serialized stream that is associated with the new <xref href="System.Net.WebException"></xref>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Net.WebException"></xref> class with the specified error message and nested exception.

The <xref:System.Net.WebException> instance is initialized with the <xref:System.Exception.Message%2A> property set to the value of `message` and the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property set to the value of `innerException`.
If `message` is `null`, the <xref:System.Exception.Message%2A> property is initialized to a system-supplied message.
The <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> and <xref:System.Net.WebException.Response%2A> properties are initialized to `null`.
The <xref:System.Net.WebException.Status%2A> property is initialized to <xref:System.Net.WebExceptionStatus.RequestCanceled>.
The text of the error message.
A nested exception.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Net.WebException"></xref> class with the specified error message and status.

The <xref:System.Net.WebException> instance is initialized with the <xref:System.Exception.Message%2A> property set to the value of `message` and the <xref:System.Net.WebException.Status%2A> property set to the value of `status`.
If `message` is `null`, the <xref:System.Exception.Message%2A> property is initialized to a system-supplied message.
The <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> and <xref:System.Net.WebException.Response%2A> properties are initialized to `null`.
The text of the error message.
One of the <xref href="System.Net.WebExceptionStatus"></xref> values.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Net.WebException"></xref> class with the specified error message, nested exception, status, and response.

The <xref:System.Net.WebException> instance is initialized with the <xref:System.Exception.Message%2A> property set to the value of `message`, the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property set to the value of `innerException`, the <xref:System.Net.WebException.Status%2A> property set to the value of `status`, and the <xref:System.Net.WebException.Response%2A> property set to the value of `response`.
If `message` is `null`, the <xref:System.Exception.Message%2A> property is initialized to a system-supplied message.
The text of the error message.
A nested exception.
One of the <xref href="System.Net.WebExceptionStatus"></xref> values.
A <xref href="System.Net.WebResponse"></xref> instance that contains the response from the remote host.
Populates a <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> instance with the data needed to serialize the <xref href="System.Net.WebException"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> to be used.
The <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext"></xref> to be used.
Gets the response that the remote host returned.
Some Internet protocols, such as HTTP, return otherwise valid responses indicating that an error has occurred at the protocol level.

When the response to an Internet request indicates an error, <xref:System.Net.WebRequest.GetResponse%2A?displayProperty=fullName> sets the <xref:System.Net.WebException.Status%2A> property to <xref:System.Net.WebExceptionStatus?displayProperty=fullName> and provides the <xref:System.Net.WebResponse> that contains the error message in the <xref:System.Net.WebException.Response%2A> property of the <xref:System.Net.WebException> that was thrown.
The application can examine the <xref:System.Net.WebResponse> to determine the actual error.
If a response is available from the Internet resource, a <xref href="System.Net.WebResponse"></xref> instance that contains the error response from an Internet resource; otherwise, `null`.
Gets the status of the response.
The <xref:System.Net.WebException.Status%2A> property indicates the reason for the <xref:System.Net.WebException>.
The value of <xref:System.Net.WebException.Status%2A> is one of the <xref:System.Net.WebExceptionStatus> values.
The <xref:System.Net.WebExceptionStatus.ProxyNameResolutionFailure> error is not returned to [!INCLUDE[win8_appname_long](~/includes/win8-appname-long-md.md)] apps.
One of the <xref href="System.Net.WebExceptionStatus"></xref> values.
Serializes this instance into the specified <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> object.
The object into which this <xref href="System.Net.WebException"></xref> will be serialized.
The destination of the serialization.
